turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --scared the living shit out of us.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: This is a goddamn disaster. Let's just pack it up and go.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I want to see the tapes.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: And what do you possibly think you're going to fucking see there?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: No idea. But if that's all we've got left--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I think we get the gist.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: We've looked at half of one tape.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: For once could you just sit down, shut up, and give something a <u>chance</u>?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're leaving--case dismissed for lack of evidence. Maybe on the ride home we can figure how the fuck we're going to graduate with no thesis.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We'll stay overnight, get a hotel--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Just...try and go back to sleep.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I get dreams. I don't like 'em.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Little boys. Looking up my skirt as I danced. Giggling.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't know what it is, but there is something <u>happening</u> here, and it's starting to scare the living shit out me, and look, I'm just <u>not</u> going to argue the point anymore--you want to stay here, stay, but I've got to get the fuck out of here, and I'm begging you to come <u>with</u> me.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --no, you're not. You love me too much. You don't want to see them kill me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The clothes--take 'em off-- I want to see every square inch--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I see for proof positive you're the goddamn witch--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --what're you saying?? I didn't have anything to do with--

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: --fuck your bullshit pieties! You were the next to die, asshole!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You're gonna owe me the rest of your life, bud.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Beta Cam's still coming back tomorrow, right?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: --Christ, they find out I let you have it for the weekend--

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You mind me asking: why the fuck?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: I know you're in there, you piece of shit!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Not until I get that Beta Cam back! We're both in a world of shit here!!

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Beer and weed is what I've got.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: So, I hear you're from New Mexico!

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: --last thing I remember were those four clowns shooting the movie--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --yeah, the goddamn stoners! Who you think stole the stuff!?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: --no, I think they're all in there.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: My ass--you saw those four fucking baboons put 'em there!

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: I don't think it was them.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Oh, who did then? Blair Witch? Snatching equipment to make her own sequel?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Well, please keep me fucking informed!

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Something happened to Anna in Burkittsville, in the woods, I don't know.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: What? That made her lose the baby?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Like hell. Play the goddamn tape.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: There, what? I didn't see anything.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Back it up, rewind, whatever you call it.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Can you zoom it or something, make it real close, real big?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: I'm the ebay Boy, remember? I can't exactly afford that kind of equipment.

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: Who do you know who can? Where do we go?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Can't you like just divine it?

turns.speaker: DOMINI
turns.text: If I could do that, I'd be at the goddamn racetrack, not here.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: I got a friend at a Lab. I could get the whole thing blown-up, enhanced--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Just let me get my coat off--I had eight cups of coffee, I'm wired for sound here.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --thank you, Heather Arendt--and arend't we glad you're here--a real witch--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: And let it be known--before we even get to Burkittsville--it's gonna be an eighteen thousand times better movie--for half the cost--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --and unlike the first one, every second of it's gonna be true! "Blair Witch: The Real Story!"

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You're a complete fucking idiot, aren't you?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Hey, Mr. Graduate Fucking Thesis here was s'posed to be driving!

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Oh, for chrissake, she was an actor.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: I take it back--she <u>wasn't</u> an actor. She's a nutjob.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: That's what Josh and Mike said.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You're not only an idiot, you're a goddamn <u>child</u>.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Why does everyone here but me have have a gigantic stick up their ass?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Hadn't even opened the thing since Cub scouts.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: So where the hell am I going to sleep?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: If you're looking at me, look elsewhere.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: I've got the Panasonic Portable DVD player.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Ask me what I don't have.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: What I never could figure about the movie?

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Three people: two guys, a girl-- sleeping in the same motel room, the same tent night after night.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Made no sense. Scared out of their minds, and the greatest stress reliever in creation right at their fingertips. Nada.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: No sense at all.  I'm a little stressed.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: What're you doing with all this shit?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Hey, I got a whole editing suite in my loft--more the fucking merrier.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Not a great idea. Especially 'cross the street.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Used to be a meat-packing plant. Slaughter on the ground floor-- carcasses schlepped up on this thing for dissection and grinding and--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Hey, hon'--this is what pays the rent and tuition.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: I spend a lot of time on e-Bay. Buying, selling--sometimes buying then re-selling at substantial mark-up, sometimes just selling crap I find in the street.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: I got the tape enhanced--and I managed to sleaze a photo blow-up. Jesus, he's gonna kill me when he finds out about the camera.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: My room, asleep, last I checked.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: She would've had to have a key, anyway, to lock the deadbolt behind her.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Well, she got out of here <u>some</u>- how because she's not here!!

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Same trees. They took Elly Kedward out to the same kind of trees.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --I look and look in the tree, all I ever see, he's always there watching, that stupid owl, over and over--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --anywhere, anywhere, all up and live, all the time--fucking owl--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: You think it's possible the tree in the Parr foundation is the same one they tied Elly Kedward to?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Heather, does that look like Domini there?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Not the place you want to announce your arrival.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: How's she going to know where to--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --things got a way of finding <u>you</u> here.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Next time try putting on shoes--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: The moon trying to shoot down through all these trees--can make things funky--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: The cart they brought Elly Kedward into the woods with--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --into the <u>Black</u> <u>Hills</u> with--200- something miles from here--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: I'd strongly advise you to join us--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --hell, I don't think I'm ever leaving this place again--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --one of us, all of us--I have no idea--brought whatever this thing is back here. We're not going to go out there and spread it around like Typhoid Mary. We're gonna figure it out, we're gonna bring a goddamn <u>end</u> to it.

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Goes right along with these two.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --f'chrissake, Heather, it's not like the two of us are gonna doze off he leaves for two seconds--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --I don't trust anybody, not even me, anymore--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: --it's the "Blair Witch Cult"--a copy-- some pages from--one of them on the site must've gotten my message--

turns.speaker: HEATHER
turns.text: Remember....what Mary Brown said-- she could see the witch's hands on my face, her mouth sucking on mine.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: This is her equally on-the-rag boy- friend, Nick Leavitt--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --they're from UMass, doing some kind of fucking term paper--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're not making Blair Witch II here.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We're all going to be if you don't hit the brakes.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You drive, I'll handle the video, okay?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Right. And the check's in the mail.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Was it <u>every</u> day or just semi- weekly you got your ass kicked as a kid?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: <u>Now</u> you can bring the vehicle to a stop: there on the left.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Either way, maybe there's a book in it, and they both make a ton of money.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No problem, just give us 'til dawn and we're gone.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Look, guys, we're cold, we're tired we're <u>shook</u>--we just want to get out of here as soon as there's light. We saw something up at Coffin Rock today--

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Due for a re-load and battery check. I'll get on it.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: --and none of 'em were mine! I-am-so-fucked, I-am-so-fucked-- where the hell was everybody???

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Cotter, I think she's right. Why would those guys go to all the trouble of stealing the camera and all this other stuff and leave the tapes?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They were making a movie--if they were going to steal anything it'd be <u>just</u> the tapes, to see if we had anything they didn't.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I dunno it's safe to even get out of the car.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: First enormous brick warehouse on your right.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Just one lock in this neighbor- hood?

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: There's four other angles, man, we haven't even--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --great: we can watch Domini sleep for hours--or, shit, maybe if we stay at it for a couple of days, maybe a deer'll dash by!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: --still go see the OB in the morning--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You wanna keep it down, she's trying to sleep.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: Sorry, I didn't think we were making that much noise.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's not a real "funny" time for us, okay?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Well, she's got to be <u>somewhere</u> here.

turns.speaker: COTTER
turns.text: No one's been in or out since you left. Would've heard the dogs.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How much of that stuff you guys been smoking?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Enough to make shapes and shadows in the dark into something else.
